title: ILLUSION OF SUCCESS Part 1
scripture_text: ‘The seventy-two returned with joy and said, “Lord, even the demons submit to us in your name.” He replied, I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven. I have given you authority to trample on snakes and scorpions and to overcome all the power of the enemy; nothing will harm you. However, do not rejoice that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”
devotional:
If we are going to develop a biblical and healthy thought-process of how we serve God in the every day, I think this is one of the best, if not the best passages to help us do that. If our understanding of serving God is not rooted in how Jesus served His Father, then we will find ourselves struggling with a host of spiritual, emotional and psychological problems.

This passage brings a huge challenge to us all. It goes way beyond the surface and deals with dominate issues of the heart. It is a passage that pulls off the covers we hide under, and exposes our real priorities and insecurities.

As the seventy two disciples return to Jesus from their mission trip, they began to tell Him about how successful it was; Jesus uses this as an opportunity to deal with a crucial issue that will prepare them for life and faithful service in the future.

Lesson 1

Service to God is not about us or what we have done.

The seventy two have just returned from the mission Jesus had sent them on, and to their surprise they were able to exercise power over demons. This was surprising for two reasons:

The context.

1.In the previous chapter (9:40), a number of the 12 disciples have failed to exorcise a demon. They were unable to do something that the seventy/seventy two were able to do. These seventy/seventy two were powerful and effective.

2.Jesus had not mentioned casting out demons in their commissioning (10:5-11), but they gained power over demons. Exorcism was not something Jesus told them to do in this commission. They were to "eat," "heal," and "tell" (v. 8b-9). The Twelve were given "power and authority over all demons" in 9:1 not the seventy/seventy two.

So think of the surprise and joy they must have felt when they returned to Jesus and began to critique their experience in ministry.

What is very interesting about these seventy/seventy two disciples is that they spoke to Jesus about their ministry after it was finished, while we usually do it the other way around. We talk to Jesus in prayer before we do it, which is both good and very important. However, maybe we don’t ‘report’ back to Jesus because we think that in doing the actual act of ministry we have completed the task. Maybe the ‘feedback’ to Jesus should be the completing act of ministry. This means that we will have a more honest and realistic understanding and appraisal of what we are doing.
prayer: Prayer. Father give me the wisdom to wisely critique the ministry you have given me.

ILLUSION OF SUCCESS Part 1

Luke 10:17-20.
‘The seventy-two returned with joy and said, “Lord, even the demons submit to us in your name.” He replied, I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven. I have given you authority to trample on snakes and scorpions and to overcome all the power of the enemy; nothing will harm you. However, do not rejoice that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”

The context.

Prayer: Prayer. Father give me the wisdom to wisely critique the ministry you have given me.
